perturbation.original_text: For calendar year 2016, the Franchise Fee shall be paid to Grantor on or before March 31, 2017.

perturbation.explanation: Virginia law requires that franchise taxes be paid within a reasonable time frame, with specific deadlines outlined by the Virginia Department of Taxation. Delaying the payment to June 30, 2017, without reasonable justification could potentially violate the implicit requirements for timely tax payments, introducing a contradiction with state regulations.

perturbation.original_text: (b) For each succeeding calendar year during the term of this Franchise, the total annual Franchise Fee paid by Grantee to the localities shall be the base year total annual Franchise Fee increased by three (3) percent compounded annually over the term of the Franchise. perturbation.changed_text: (b) For each succeeding calendar year during the term of this Franchise, the total annual Franchise Fee paid by Grantee to the localities shall be the base year total annual Franchise Fee increased by three (3) percent compounded annually over the term of the Franchise.
